name: places/ChIJQfYrEfNZwokRFPKHZM6aH4w
adrFormatAddress: 201 1st Ave., New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text: Kamayan Experience was unforgettable! The 18 course tasting menu delivered a home cooked meal with an elevated experience! I also suggest getting the drink pairing with the meal, it was delightful! Hats off to Chef Eric Valdez and his incredible staff!

text.text: Kamayan Experience was unforgettable! The 18 course tasting menu delivered a home cooked meal with an elevated experience! I also suggest getting the drink pairing with the meal, it was delightful! Hats off to Chef Eric Valdez and his incredible staff!

originalText.text:
I went with my family to do their tasting Kamayan menu. It’s setup in the back and definitely had potential. I’m going to break this review into 2 parts, before the incident and after.

Before: The meal was intriguing. The flavor profile had more vinegar than I had expected and I think it would have been nice to choose the amount of sauce we put on instead of them just pouring the amounts they did. Some dishes felt as if it drowned in sauce (like the seaweed) and if they had just pulled back, it could have been great. The “Kamayan” part was only half true since a majority of the meal was not eaten on the banana leaf table, but on small plates they brought which made it feel gimmicky. It had potential to be good if they had just left it on the table instead of bringing them on individual plates. The service and the stories from the staff was great though. The meal felt like it needed a reprieve from the intense flavors that we were getting. Overall I think it really had potential, but needs a lot of fine tuning.

After: the tasting is done in the back section of the restaurants which you need to go up 2 steps that blend into the floor and very difficult to see. I even saw a staff trip on it lightly during our meal. My 60+ year old mother missed the step going to the restroom and fell to the floor and we ended the meal there. Though they tried to help, we were still given the bill to leave gratuity which felt extremely rude in the moment. I didn’t have the energy to argue and prioritize getting my mother the medical attention she needed, but I getting the bill in those final moments left a disgusting taste in my mouth.

Put some caution tape on those steps for your own sake if not for customer safety.

originalText.text:
Reviewed for bar menu only. A fan of Unapologetic Foods, been to Dhamaka, Masalawala, Rowdy Rooster etc. Was looking forward to the filipino deconstructed kamayan concept and came out very disappointed. To start the front lighting is very "romantic" so much that the vibrancy of the food in some of the photos with flash is none existent when in person Portions are so small that after $60+ pre tip/tax on food  were still not full.

Tried most items on the limited menu. The KFC while moist and tender inside were lacking flabor and underseasoned. Various skewers were undercooked, oversauced and not best quality meat. The eel especially shiny with sauce even under the low light and fatty belly oily and not rendered well. The No. 5 testicle soup just 2 tiny bowls and hard to differentiate ingredients.  Green mango sticks in box with dipping sauce is just uninspiring. Finally $8 for a 8oz Mexican sprite is just robbery.

Hopefully other diners fare better with the tasting menu with I think 2 of the bar items as part of it.

originalText.text:
Came here for the kamayan experience recently and was blown away. The food was delicious and each course had a thoughtful story. The service was incredible (they gave us little goodie bags at the end). And I am just swelling with pride that a Filipino restaurant/dining experience like this exists.

I would come again in a heartbeat and have recommended Naks to almost everyone that has asked me about it.

originalText.text: Easily one of the best tasting menus I’ve ever had. Only would place it behind Pujol or Quintonil. Good mix of unique small bites and heftier classics (Lechón). Drink pairing was a mix thoughtful cocktails and simple wine pairings and not just 6 glasses of wine shoe horned in there. The cartoon booklet at the end was a nice touch. $450 for two with one beverage pairing, tax, and tip.
